name: Potassium Chloride
indications: potassium chloride oral solution indicated treatment prophylaxis hypokalemia without metabolic alkalosis , patients dietary management potassium-rich foods diuretic dose reduction insufficient .
contraindications: dilute prior . ( 2.1 , 5.1 ) monitor serum potassium adjust accordingly . ( 2.2 , 2.3 ) serum potassium concentration < 2.5 meq/l , intravenous potassium instead oral supplementation . ( 2.1 ) treatment hypokalemia : adults : initial doses range 40 100 meq/day 2 5 divided doses : limit doses 40 meq per dose . total daily dose exceed 200 meq . ( 2.2 ) pediatric patients aged birth 16 years old : 2 4 meq/kg/day divided doses ; exceed 1 meq/kg single-dose 40 meq whichever lower ; deficits severe ongoing losses great , consider intravenous therapy . total daily dose exceed 100 meq . ( 2.3 ) maintenance prophylaxis hypokalemia : adults : typical dose 20 meq per day . ( 2.2 ) pediatric patients aged birth 16 years old : typical dose 1 meq/kg/day . exceed 3 meq/kg/day . ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions: potassium chloride oral solution usp , 20 meq supplied light pink orange powder orange odor . available follows : pouch contains 1.5 g potassium chloride providing potassium 20 meq chloride 20 meq carton 30 pouches : ndc 60219-1617-3 carton 100 pouches : ndc 60219-1617-8 storage store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) ; excursions permitted 15° 30°c ( 59° 86°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . dispense tight , light-resistant container defined usp . protect light . rx manufactured : amneal pharmaceuticals private limited ahmedabad 382220 , india distributed : amneal pharmaceuticals llc bridgewater , nj 08807 rev . 12-2022-00
adverseReactions: potassium chloride contraindicated patients potassium sparing diuretics .
indications_original: Potassium chloride for oral solution is indicated for the treatment and prophylaxis of hypokalemia with or without metabolic alkalosis, in patients for whom dietary management with potassium-rich foods or diuretic dose reduction is insufficient.
contraindications_original: Dilute prior to administration. (2.1 , 5.1) Monitor serum potassium and adjust dosage accordingly. ( 2.2 , 2.3 ) If serum potassium concentration is <2.5 mEq/L, use intravenous potassium instead of oral supplementation. ( 2.1 ) Treatment of hypokalemia: Adults: Initial doses range from 40 to 100 mEq/day in 2 to 5 divided doses: limit doses to 40 mEq per dose. Total daily dose should not exceed 200 mEq. ( 2.2 ) Pediatric patients aged birth to 16 years old: 2 to 4 mEq/kg/day in divided doses; not to exceed 1 mEq/kg as a single-dose or 40 mEq whichever is lower; if deficits are severe or ongoing losses are great, consider intravenous therapy. Total daily dose should not exceed 100 mEq. ( 2.3 ) Maintenance or Prophylaxis of hypokalemia: Adults: Typical dose is 20 mEq per day. ( 2.2 ) Pediatric patients aged birth to 16 years old: typical dose is 1 mEq/kg/day. Do not to exceed 3 mEq/kg/day. ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Potassium chloride for oral solution USP, 20 mEq is supplied as a light pink to orange powder with an orange odor.  It is available as follows:
                  Each pouch contains 1.5 g of potassium chloride providing potassium 20 mEq and chloride 20 mEq
                  Carton of 30 pouches:             NDC   60219-1617-3
Carton of 100 pouches:           NDC   60219-1617-8
                  
                     Storage
                  
                  Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F); excursions permitted between 15° to 30°C (59° to 86°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature].
                  Dispense in a tight, light-resistant container as defined in the USP. PROTECT from LIGHT.
                  Rx only
                  Manufactured by:
                  
                     Amneal Pharmaceuticals Private Limited
                  
                  Ahmedabad 382220, INDIA
                  Distributed by:
                     Amneal Pharmaceuticals LLC
                     Bridgewater, NJ 08807
                  Rev. 12-2022-00
adverseReactions_original: Potassium chloride is contraindicated in patients on potassium sparing diuretics.
